body:
ArrayIncludesIndexofAssembler::GenerateSmiOrObject - builtins/builtins-array-gen.cc
Preconditions/guards snippet:
- index_var starts from SmiUntag(from_index)
- array_length_untagged computed from PositiveSmiUntag(array_length)
- early checks for search_element type: TaggedIsSmi -> smi path, IsUndefined -> undef handling (includes only), IsHeapNumberMap -> heap number handling, string instance type -> string loop, BigInt instance -> bigint loop
- SIMD fastcall guarded by kCanVectorize and array length threshold (kSIMDThreshold)
- In ident_loop: UnsafeLoadFixedArrayElement(elements, index) and TaggedEqual(element_k, search_element) checks
- In heap_num_loop: handles NaN specially for includes (nan_loop) and compares Float64Equal for Smi/HeapNumber, uses vectorized external C function for smi or object if possible
- String loop: compares string lengths then calls StringEqual_Core, or falls back to runtime
- BigInt loop: calls Runtime::kBigIntEqualToBigInt when needed
- Returns True/False or Smi index based on variant
Explanation: Smi/Object path handles SameValueZero vs strict indexOf differences, NaN handling (SameValueZero makes NaN==NaN), undefined vs holes for includes variant, vectorization hooks for performance.
explanation: Detailed logic for Smi/Objects include/indexOf. Shows type dispatch for search_element, SIMD fast-paths, unsafe element loads, NaN handling (SameValueZero), and string/bigint fallbacks.
